meanings.definition: A type of wood used for making candles.
meanings.sent1: The candlemaker gathered some candlewood to craft beautiful candles.
meanings.sent2: The candle factory received a shipment of candlewood for production.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the candlewood for regular wood and tried to nibble on it.
meanings.sent4: The candlewood stood tall in the forest, ready to be transformed into glowing candles.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the candlewood filled the workshop, promising cozy evenings ahead.

meanings.sent1: She lit a candlewood to brighten up the room during the power outage.
meanings.sent2: The candlewood burned slowly, casting a warm glow in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the magical flame of the candlewood.
meanings.sent4: The flickering light of the candlewood danced on the walls, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The candlewood released a soothing fragrance as it melted, creating a cozy ambiance.

meanings.sent1: The forest ranger pointed out the candlewood tree, known for its valuable wood.
meanings.sent2: The candlewood tree swayed gently in the breeze, its branches full of leaves.
meanings.sent3: The birds nested happily in the branches of the candlewood tree, enjoying its shade.
meanings.sent4: The candlewood tree stood out among the others, its trunk sturdy and tall.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the candlewood tree blossoms filled the air, signaling the arrival of spring.
